content: Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 27 Feb 2019Why is there a difference between the price which you pay for the stock and the price you receive of the stock? For eg. i pay $25.10 but my stock price is $25 due to this thing called bid ask spread?1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Lok Yang TengLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 28 Feb 2019Bid-ask spread is the difference between the bid and ask price due to demand and supply respectively. in your case bid price is 25.00, and ask price is 25.100 comments0
